news.title: Streeting vows to keep NHS services running as doctor strike begins
news.summary: Hospitals are told to cancel non-urgent work only in exceptional circumstances as a five-day resident doctors' strike starts.

news.title: Samaritans to close more than 100 branches
news.summary: The charity's chief executive says "at least half" of their branches will close in the UK and Ireland.

news.title: Kelly Osbourne lost 'best friend' after Ozzy's death
news.summary: She has made her first comments since her father's death at the age of 76 on Tuesday, posting lyrics from the song Changes.

news.title: Justice department official meets Epstein accomplice Maxwell
news.summary: The meeting comes as pressure grows on the Trump administration to release files linked to  the disgraced financier's sex trafficking network.

news.title: People with gluten allergies to be given cash cards to help pay for their food
news.summary: One woman who took part in the pilot says it only "scratches the surface" of food bills.

news.title: One in five children in Gaza City is malnourished, UN aid agency says
news.summary: The UN agency for Palestinians says it has thousands of truckloads of supplies near Gaza which it wants to deliver.

news.title: Israel and US leave Gaza ceasefire talks in Qatar
news.summary: US special envoy Steve Witkoff accuses Hamas of showing "a lack of desire to reach a ceasefire in Gaza".

news.title: The Papers: 'Threat to NHS from strikes' and 'UK must do more on Gaza'
news.summary: Doctors' strikes and the UK response to the humanitarian situation in Gaza lead Friday's papers.

news.title: Ren√©e Rapp: Media training is boring, I can't give fluffy answers
news.summary: Rapp made headlines by going off script on a press tour for the Mean Girls movie. She has no regrets.

news.title: Trump to fly into Scotland for golf club visits - and a meeting with Starmer
news.summary: His private visit is exceptional as US presidents rarely promote their personal interests so publicly while in office.
